basic.floral_language:
Michelia champaca
Floriography: reserved, pure, solemn.
Michelia champaca is an evergreen plant which grows sturdy, tall and straight stem. Leaves are round oval and leathery. Flowers are strongly fragrant with six thick petals. Widely cultivated for its enjoyable fragrance.
The plant grows best under shading places. Direct bright sunlight should be avoid. Blooms in May to September for two to three weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-May, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.color: Flower color white, light yellow, light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes weak shade environments, avoid direct strong light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring, except flowering stages
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
